data.title: Game crashes on range(0,100000000)
data.body: I get a Game crash on `range(0,100000000)` and no error messages.

data.title: Remove two redundant CI builds
data.body: We only have 5 build nodes on Travis CI, and building every PR takes a huge time.

data.title: Rename KEY_KP_SUBSTRACT to KEY_KP_SUBTRACT
data.body:
The former name was incorrect in English, though for us latin lovers it's an understandable mistake.
Second part of and closes #3626.

I chose not to bother keeping the old name and adding deprecating warnings; I'll admit it's partly because I have no clue how to do that without adding a lot of clutter :p But also the issue is pretty easy to fix for the couple users that might be affected.

data.title: Setting a Color's hue to 1.0 gives the wrong hue.
data.body: If you set the hue of a Color to 1.0, it results in the wrong hue: instead of a deep red, you get a purple. This occurs both when using the Color.h property, and when setting the hue via the color picker. 0.9999999 and 0 both appear to have correct results.

data.title: math/octree.h: Condition ' Math::is_nan(p_aabb.size.x) ' is true
data.body:
Seen when closing the editor with a project open:

```
ERROR: create: Condition ' Math::is_nan(p_aabb.size.x) ' is true. returned: 0
   At: core/math/octree.h:827.
```

(printed 6 times in a row, if that can give a clue as to what triggers it)

data.title: Remove unimplemented SceneAnimationImport plugin from menu
data.body:
The code structure is still available if someone wanted to implement it.
Issue #3667 will be kept as a reminder for the added todo.

data.title: [code] does not set a monospace font as expected
data.body:
The code that parses the `[code]` tag when displaying the in-editor help claims to be setting the font to a monospaced one [1], but it does not appear to be working.

See e.g., after adding the tag in this method:
![spectacle tj1713](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/13123848/9b52c13e-d5be-11e5-84b3-87d0815f0b46.png)

The output in the editor:
![spectacle bc1713](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/13123882/c853ad2e-d5be-11e5-90d5-d7c262ad745a.png)

No particular formatting is visible.

[1] https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/editor_help.cpp#L1204-L1209

data.title: Implement support for [codeblock] tag in help
data.body:
It allows to define a multiline space-indented code block that will be properly parsed by the reST converter for the online docs.
The in-editor help understand the [codeblock] tag as it supposedly understand [code] already (i.e. it just seems to discard it, though the code was supposed to switch it to a monospace font, but that's likely another issue.

data.title: Fix NavigationPolygon doc + drop polygon path finder demo
data.body: For the demo, it is obsoleted by the easier NavigationPolygon API and the feature will likely be dropped in the future (see #3740).

data.title: Play custom scene(quick run scene) icon remains checked
data.body:
The Icon is not releasing.
1.Press "Play custom scene buggy".
2.Close the window or "Open/select" scene. It is still showing icon_folder is pressed.

data.title: Correct octree's AABB intersect test, fixes #3576 and #3253
the ability to get vertices/edges from any shape2D please?
data.body:
I'm working with the navigation2D and I'm trying to make it dynamic. so I have to set the navigation polygon at runtime.
obstacles usually are collision objects that has some collision shape/polygon attached to it. so I wanted to use that collision shape to feed the navigation polygon. I think that would work with collision polygon since you do have the option to retrieve an array of Vector2's (I still can't get the outline from them).

so please add a function that retrieves vertices/edges from any shape2D?

data.title: Fix "Play custom scene" button and allow to restart
data.body:
Fixed calling of __quick_run_ method from _quick_open_ signal, closes #3742
Added option to restart the custom scene being run, closes #3747

Sorry for single PR...

data.title: Fixed String::camelcase_to_underscore() so it works in all cases.
data.body: Fixes PR #1650

data.title: Play custom scene(quick run scene) buggy
data.body:
UPDATE:#3747

When I select a scene to run it I get this.

   At: core/object.cpp:1210.

data.title: doc: explain DampedSpringJoint2D parameters.
polygon path finder demo is now interactive and dynamic
VideoPlayer Node freezes the game if playing a video stream without audio track
data.body:
How to recreate:
Add a videoplayer node, load the stream and set autoplay on. Run the scene, enjoy.

![error_godot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6961524/13106710/fe790c28-d569-11e5-8681-6d13987fc72b.png)

If you want to recreate this issue you can use this video:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/90624121/video-no-audiotrack.ogv

data.title: stretch only certain area of image
data.body:
it is possible to set an image in a panel and stretch image when panel it is resized.
But it would be useful to stretch only certain area of image.
e.g. in this image I want to stretch only yellow areas and not to stretch red areas

![box](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12212708/13106161/1eee71f8-d567-11e5-9b2f-f8368da50ebd.png)

data.title: non english community resources?
data.body:
i was chatting with a russian godot engine dev on irc and said there are about 300 people on a russian social network site they made.
http://vk.com/godot_engine

however i think their community is isolated from rest of godot because they don't speak english so im wondering if there are any plans for non english speaking users.

what are the plans for non english resources/community (like links , urls etc)
or are there any plants in translating the site into different languages?

data.title: Enhancement wish for "Create New Node" Window
data.body:
**Old:**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/13088386/4f58f69a-d4ec-11e5-9e64-d2b6850e7c93.png)
**New:**
![node_filter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/13089554/87e848bc-d4f1-11e5-8a73-1daf7a08b030.png)
![control_filter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/13089564/907924f6-d4f1-11e5-8597-46b51cd3b6c1.png)

**Filter** is type of node.
- Node = everything
- CanvasItem = all Control node + all Node2D node
- Control = all Control node

and so on..

**Favorites** and **Recent** is like "Open a Resource/File" Window.

data.title: Experimental Docker image for godot
data.body:
Hi.
This is an experimental Docker image that can be used on Linux, Windows and Mac to build custom versions of godot in the same way on all platforms, specially when someone wants to integrate a new godot module.
An initial help provided in README.

data.title: github wiki VS godotengine.org wiki  = which one is main wiki? should you get rid of one?
data.body:
There are 2 wikis but which one is the main one? Which one has the freshest information and gets updated the most?

From what I understand the godotengine.org wiki was made later to give more editing access to  everyone because the github one only main devs have access to.

I prefer github one but  I can see how godotengine.org one would be more accessible to editors. should you get rid of github one? I would personally prefer the github one. Or if possible another github account could have the documentation. I am not sure. Or maybe even using a wiki site.

data.title: Doc viewer selection works only on upper half
data.body: I have problems selecting doc text in the godot doc viewer. I can select the upper half but not the lower. I have to scroll down first to select the lower half.

data.title: Redefine var not showing error
data.body:
Should this show an error? me_not_null is already defined but I can compile it and get a null on the second print.

```
func _ready():
    bug("me_not_null")

func bug(me_not_null):
    print(me_not_null)
    var me_not_null = me_not_null
    print(me_not_null)
```

data.title: Add Vulkan renderer
data.body:
Hi!

It would be nice to support Vulkan API, since it's [already released](https://www.khronos.org/vulkan/).

data.title: refix particles3d issue, bringing down the amount limit to 1024
data.body: The previous fix raised the max amount to 4096, but that matches the default max value for the rasterizer's rendered objects. It sounds more sane to reduce the max allowed particles to 1024, also matching the 2d particle system.

data.title: Joystick bug(s) on linux
data.body:
(ping @Hinsbart) I'm seeing this behavior (with a PS3 pad on linux)
- press a button, which triggers a call to load() that blocks the main thread for 1 second
- during that second, release the button
- after the load() is finished and the main loop is back to number, the release event doesn't seem to be generated
- press the button again, the event is not generated again
- release the button, the release event is generated

There seems to be 2 bugs, the first lost event is during the time where the main thread is blocked (for example while loading a new level, etc). The 2nd lost event, could it be because the engine thinks the button is already pressed so it omits it? This is ok to do for axis values and mouse movement, but we shouldn't do it for buttons.. We want to send every event that happened, even if the end result is the same state that we previously had. Users are not fast enough, so we won't have more than 2 or 3 events from the same button in one frame (and in that case, the FPS has to be _very_ low).
